title: Ticket #697: condor_pool absent list tool should use condorstatus exclude list
description:
The CSL believes they should maintain the canonical list of where Condor is welcome to run (CSL #377232, adesmet). They export a list of machines marked Y or N for condor as /common/usr/share/Info/condorstatus AKA /afs/cs.wisc.edu/s/lab-1/common/lib/volatile/condorstatus. The condor_pool absent list tool should use this file as the canonical source of machines; if a machine is marked as "N" and isn't running Condor, it should not appear as absent. If a machine is marked as "N" and is running Condor, we might want to report that, but that seems lower priority.

(There are some reconciliation problems in making the CSL the canonical source, that's being addressed in #449.)
